TopicTitle: Scott Manley - An Early Look At 0.21

Articles.Content: great job KSP guys

Scott does it well as always

A bunch of us other YouTubers have .21 previews up as well. Check around.

Here's mine:
I cannot wait for the full release! I hope they update the stock craft to account for the reaction wheels!

Don't like hearing turning uses power. It would make more sense on unmanned ships. And Power isn't something that can be made Infinite with the Dev console.

Sure, I can throw on some RTGs to counteract it, but it's how much power it chews through, has me concerned.

Don't like hearing turning uses power. It would make more sense on unmanned ships. And Power isn't something that can be made Infinite with the Dev console.

Sure, I can throw on some RTGs to counteract it, but it's how much power it chews through, has me concerned.

Those reaction wheels aren't going to turn and stop themselves. A small solar panel will recharge your battery in no time.

Don't like hearing turning uses power. It would make more sense on unmanned ships. And Power isn't something that can be made Infinite with the Dev console.

Sure, I can throw on some RTGs to counteract it, but it's how much power it chews through, has me concerned.

Makes perfect sense that it would use power. It's a mechanical process. Really, even Kerbal life support should use power. Make it important to pack a power source.
He explains everything BUT the little building between the VAB and the Tracking-station, WHAT DOES THAT BUILDING DO?!

He explains everything BUT the little building between the VAB and the Tracking-station, WHAT DOES THAT BUILDING DO?!

It has no function at the moment, maybe it will come with a function in the full release?

My guess is that it's an astronaut training center or something?
Apparently it's the new Mission Control building.

The windows on the front of the building remind me of the old style NASA mission control building from the Apollo era. I think. But yeah, no one has said what the mystery building is but my guess is some kind of mission control maybe.
In one of the videos of .21 that I saw, it's mentioned that they crashed a plane into it and the flight log said "collided with mission control" (or something to that effect).

Scott does it well as always

A bunch of us other YouTubers have .21 previews up as well. Check around.

Here's mine:

nice vid, thank you!
Gotta buzz that tower! The new Kerbal Space Center looks awesome, and Scott's attempts at flying are always hilarious.
